tasks.title: Task 23: Implement Real ArcPool Pooling Logic
tasks.description: Implement actual pooling logic in ArcPool. Currently ArcPool::get_or_create always creates new Arc instances and doesn't actually pool. Use Serena MCP to analyze current ArcPool implementation. Use Context7 MCP to research Arc pooling patterns.
tasks.details: ArcPool exists but is a placeholder - it doesn't actually reuse Arc instances. This implements real pooling that reuses Arc wrappers to reduce allocation overhead in fan-out scenarios.

subtasks.title: Research Arc Pooling Strategies
subtasks.description: Use Context7 MCP to research Arc pooling strategies. Consider storing unwrapped values and re-wrapping, or using a different approach. Research limitations of Arc pooling (can't easily reuse Arc instances). Document findings.

subtasks.title: Redesign ArcPool Implementation
subtasks.description: Redesign ArcPool to actually pool values. Since Arc instances can't be easily reused, consider pooling the underlying values instead. Store Vec<T> in pool, wrap in Arc when needed. Use Serena MCP to analyze current implementation in zero_copy.rs.

subtasks.title: Implement Value-Based Pooling
subtasks.description: Implement pooling that stores T values (not Arc<T>). When get_or_create is called, try to get a value from pool, wrap in Arc, and return. When return_arc is called, unwrap Arc and return value to pool if possible.

subtasks.title: Add Pool Statistics and Monitoring
subtasks.description: Add methods to track pool hit rate, pool size, and allocation statistics. This helps users understand pool effectiveness. Add metrics for pool efficiency.

subtasks.title: Integrate ArcPool into Fan-Out Operations
subtasks.description: Update fan-out operations in node.rs to use ArcPool when available. Get Arc from pool instead of always creating new. Return Arc to pool after use. Use Serena MCP to find all fan-out locations.

subtasks.title: Add ArcPool Tests and Benchmarks
subtasks.description: Add tests verifying ArcPool actually reuses values and reduces allocations. Create benchmarks comparing pooled vs non-pooled Arc creation in fan-out scenarios. Measure allocation reduction.
